Event.name: Abusing
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame an <fen>Abuser</fen> repeatedly treats the <fen>Victim</fen> in a cruel and violent way, including physically harming or forcing the <fen>Victim</fen> to engage in sexual activity against their will. The <fen>Victim</fen> usually lacks the power to resist or fight back. A <fen>Type</fen> of abuse may be indicated. There may also be a <fen>Degree</fen>. <ex> <fex name="Abuser">Her father</fex> <fex name="Type">verbally</fex> <t>abused</t> <fex name="Victim">her mother</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Abuser
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Abuser</fen> subjects the <fen>Victim</fen> to repeated verbal, physical, emotional or sexual attacks. <ex><fex name="Abuser">Fred</fex> <t>abused</t> Martha by locking her into a closet .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the recipient of the <fen>Abuser</fen>'s actions. <ex>Fred <t>abused</t> <fex name="Victim">Martha</fex> by locking her into a closet .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Type
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Type</fen> is used for the domain in which the <fen>Abuser</fen> mistreats the <fen>Victim</fen>. <ex>Fred is known for his <fex name="Type">emotional</fex> <t>abuse</t> of women.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Degree</fen> is the extent to which the abuse occurs.
<ex><fex name="Abuser">Fred</fex> <t>abused</t> Martha <fex name="Degree">alot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the abuse occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the abuse occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Manner</fen> is used for any description of the abuse event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Abuser</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>It is fair to say that it was <fex name="Man">malicious</fex> <t>abuse</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Abuser</fen> accomplishes the abuse.
<ex>Fred <t>abused</t> Martha <fex name="Means">by locking her into a closet</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Abuser</fen> to accomplish the abuse.
<ex>Look, being <t>battered</t> <fex name="Instrument">with a mallet</fex> is no one's idea of a good time.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Abuser</fen> intends to accomplish by performing the abuse.
<ex>They are <t>abusive</t> <fex name="Purp">in order to get back at those who abused them</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The amount of time that abuse occurs.
<ex>She had been <t>battered</t> <fex name="Dur">for years</fex> before she even knew there was anything serious wrong.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition:
<def-root>How often abuse occurs.
<ex>She had been abused <fex name="Freq">too much</fex> as a child <fex name="Freq">to let it happen again</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the Abusing event began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: abuse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cruelly mistreat, esp. physically or sexually

lexUnit.name: batter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: subject (one's spouse, partner, or child) to repeated violence and assault

lexUnit.name: domestic violence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: violence that occurs inside a family

lexUnit.name: maltreat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: treat cruelly or with violence.

lexUnit.name: maltreatment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: cruel, improper actions taken upon someone.
